lead_paragraph: Ina Garten, otherwise known as “the Barefoot Contessa,” needed a kitchen large enough for herself and an assistant to test recipes. The solution? Build an entirely separate structure next to her house, featuring two Sub-Zero refrigerators, an eight-burner Viking stove, two ovens and more. Continue reading in the Real Estate section »

headline.main: More Square Footage for a Shoeless Cook
